DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this multi-center, prospective observational study is to determine the feasibility of a potential interventional study with fidaxomicin. The incidence and clinical aspects of Clostridium difficile infection (CDI) in neonates will be determined, and it will be assessed whether a subgroup can be identified where treatment with fidaxomicin therapy might improve outcome.
DOC.brief_title: To Determine the Feasibility of a Fidaxomicin Study in Neonates and to Assess C. Difficile (Clostridium Difficile) Involvement in the Pathogenesis
DOC.criteria: Subject is suffering from diarrhea or other signs or symptoms consistent with CDAD (as described in section 5.2.3) Presence of either toxin A or B (or both) of C. difficile in the stool within 24 hours prior to enrollment using the C. difficile Quik Chek CompleteÂ® diagnostic test, provided by the sponsor Subject will be excluded from participation if any of the following apply: Preterm neonates Negative C. difficile toxin test
